channel.title: Chances of getting caught download torrents
channel.description: What are the chances of getting caught download illegal software using a bittorrent client. It usually takes me about 30 minutes to download the things I download and once I am finished with the download I don't seed and I delete the torrent.

item.title: Chances of getting caught download torrents
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“T4_, post:44, topic:278901”][quote author=communist link=topic=368135.msg2795080#msg2795080 date=1243025024]
I didn’t say hide. I just said it’d be harder for them to get.
[/quote]
They have complete one more task: registering; not that hard.[/quote]You can’t register on a good tracker because it’s invite only…

Read full topic
item.source: Chances of getting caught download torrents

item.title: Chances of getting caught download torrents
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“Greeny, post:20, topic:278901”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=368135.msg2788214#msg2788214 date=1242593605]

Ah my ratio is 0.5 so I think Im doing just fine. Ive downloaded 48.2 GB and uploaded 24 GB

0.50 would get you kicked off most private trackers.

1.00 is barely acceptable.

I recommend at least a 2.0 on private trackers; they mostly seed well - return the favour.
[/quote]

Well as I said, 1.0 is barely acceptable. I’d say 2-3 would be reasonable in most cases.

Also has anyone suggested he could just get a seedbox?[/quote]
I agree. I use IPTorrents, and I try to keep my ratio at or above 2. It’s currently sitting at 2.040.

Read full topic
item.source: Chances of getting caught download torrents

item.title: Chances of getting caught download torrents
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

You need to be either very unlucky or a big uploader that jumps off the background.

Read full topic

item.title: Chances of getting caught download torrents
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“communist, post:41, topic:278901”]Using a private tracker reduces them being able to track you…

You can see all the IP’s on somewhere like TPB, but in a private tracker like Revo, that’s not much of a problem :)[/quote]
Uh no; private trackers do not hide the address of any peers. In fact, many anti-p2p companies have infiltrated many private trackers.

Read full topic
item.source: Chances of getting caught download torrents

item.title: Chances of getting caught download torrents
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Mopman:

And how exactly do you download without uploading, using torrent? Very slowly? Or do you just use USENET and such?

Most providers offer free use of Usenet. Most have a retention of about 10-20 days, and if you want more you don’t have to pay much for it.

Read full topic

item.source: Chances of getting caught download torrents

item.title: Chances of getting caught download torrents
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“mwiebelhaus, post:24, topic:278901”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=368135.msg2788411#msg2788411 date=1242599175]

Well of course private and public torrents are two different things. I’d actually be willing to seed on private trackers because there is a 1 in 1,000,000,000,000 chance of getting caught that way. I think 0.5 is good enough for public trackers. Some times if I forgot about a torrent I will seed for about 5.0

On good private trackers, PeerGuardian will block 1-5 connections in a two hour period. On public trackers (such as ThePirateBay), it will block hundreds. I normally don’t seed/download on public trackers, there is no point.
[/quote]

Well when I fired up peerguardian my download speed stayed the same.[/quote]
It shouldn’t; I meant I don’t use public trackers because the seeders (if any) are not generous and allocate < 5KB/s of bandwidth.

Read full topic
item.source: Chances of getting caught download torrents

Well of course private and public torrents are two different things. I’d actually be willing to seed on private trackers because there is a 1 in 1,000,000,000,000 chance of getting caught that way. I think 0.5 is good enough for public trackers. Some times if I forgot about a torrent I will seed for about 5.0
[/quote]
On good private trackers, PeerGuardian will block 1-5 connections in a two hour period. On public trackers (such as ThePirateBay), it will block hundreds. I normally don’t seed/download on public trackers, there is no point.[/quote]

Well when I fired up peerguardian my download speed stayed the same.

Read full topic
